intro: Valerianella locusta f. carinata, commonly known as garden sorrel, is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellow flowers. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is native to Europe and western Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm, with hairy stems and a distinct, tangy flavor due to its high concentration of oxalic acid. It thrives in cool, moist conditions and is often cultivated as a leaf vegetable or for its ornamental value.
